body_html:
I guess tf.keras will be the main stream of TensorFlow high level API because Estimator seems to be moved to another repository.

However, tf.keras can not use CollectiveAllReduceStrategy for multi-worker case (that is spacified here).

If we want to implement multi-worker case, the best way is use tf.keras, convert it to Estimator with tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator, and using CollectiveAllReduceStrategy?
body_text:
I guess tf.keras will be the main stream of TensorFlow high level API because Estimator seems to be moved to another repository.
However, tf.keras can not use CollectiveAllReduceStrategy for multi-worker case (that is spacified here).
If we want to implement multi-worker case, the best way is use tf.keras, convert it to Estimator with  tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator, and using CollectiveAllReduceStrategy?
body:
I guess `tf.keras` will be the main stream of TensorFlow high level API because Estimator seems to be moved to [another repository](https://github.com/tensorflow/estimator).

However, `tf.keras` can not use `CollectiveAllReduceStrategy` for multi-worker case (that is spacified [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/keras#multiple_gpus)).

If we want to implement multi-worker case, the best way is use `tf.keras`, convert it to Estimator with `
tf.keras.estimator.model_to_estimator`, and using `CollectiveAllReduceStrategy`?
